title: Calories in Chopped Pork
meta_description: Discover calories in chopped pork per 100 g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Cooked ground pork (chopped), pan-broiled, regular fat (about 20% fat), no added seasonings or sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fat content, cooking method, added ingredients, and source; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of cooked chopped pork provides ~270 kcal and ~25 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tbsp BBQ sauce per 100 g

faqs.q: How many calories in 100 g chopped pork?
faqs.a: About 270 kcal for cooked, regular-fat chopped pork.

faqs.q: What's the protein in chopped pork?
faqs.a: Roughly 25 g protein per 100 g serving.
No carbs, fiber, or sugars in plain cooked chopped pork.

faqs.q: How does fat content affect calories in chopped pork?
faqs.a: Higher fat (e.g., 20%) increases calories; lean versions drop to ~170 kcal per 100 g.

faqs.q: Is chopped pork the same as ground pork nutritionally?
faqs.a: Yes, similar values if both are cooked without additions; varies by cut and fat.
